body_html:
I am also facing the same issue and I am pretty sure that I have the most recent version of pytorch (0.1.10+ac) , can somebody resolve this issue ? My config : Linux .0-95-generic #142-Ubuntu x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

`

import torch
torch.version
'0.1.10+ac9245a'
execfile("main_model.py")
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
File "main_model.py", line 123, in
vgg.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_dir + 'vgg_conv.pth'))
File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load
return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load
result = unpickler.load()
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'

`

body:
I am also facing the same issue and I am pretty sure that I have the most recent version of pytorch (0.1.10+ac) , can somebody resolve this issue ? My config : Linux .0-95-generic #142-Ubuntu  x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

`
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.1.10+ac9245a'
>>> execfile("main_model.py")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "main_model.py", line 123, in <module>
    vgg.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_dir + 'vgg_conv.pth'))
  File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load
    return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
  File "/users/gpu/arishabh/anaconda2/envs/opencv2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load
    result = unpickler.load()
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'

`
